   19: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   20: %%% File    : wx_event_SUITE.erl
   21: %%% Author  : Dan Gudmundsson <dan.gudmundsson@ericsson.com>
   22: %%% Description : Test event handling as much as possible
   23: %%% Created :  3 Nov 2008 by Dan Gudmundsson <dan.gudmundsson@ericsson.com>
   24: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------
   25: -module(wx_event_SUITE).
   26: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2, 
   27: 	 init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   28: 	 init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   29: 
   30: -export([connect/1, disconnect/1, disconnect_cb/1, connect_msg_20/1, connect_cb_20/1,
   31:          mouse_on_grid/1, spin_event/1, connect_in_callback/1, recursive/1,
   32:          dialog/1, char_events/1, mouse_events/1, callback_clean/1, handler_clean/1
   33:         ]).
   34: 
   35: -include("wx_test_lib.hrl").
   36: 
   37: %% Initialization functions.
   38: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   39:     wx_test_lib:init_per_suite(Config).
   40: 
   41: end_per_suite(Config) ->
   42:     wx_test_lib:end_per_suite(Config).
   43: 
   44: init_per_testcase(Func,Config) ->
   45:     wx_test_lib:init_per_testcase(Func,Config).
   46: end_per_testcase(Func,Config) -> 
   47:     wx_test_lib:end_per_testcase(Func,Config).
   48: 
   49: %% SUITE specification
   50: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}, {timetrap,{minutes,2}}].
   51: 
   52: all() ->
   53:     [connect, disconnect, disconnect_cb, connect_msg_20, connect_cb_20,
   54:      mouse_on_grid, spin_event, connect_in_callback, recursive,
   55:      dialog, char_events, mouse_events, callback_clean, handler_clean
   56:     ].
   57: 
   58: groups() -> 
   59:     [].
   60: 
   61: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   62:     Config.
   63: 
   64: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   65:     Config.
   66: 
   67:   
   68: %% The test cases
   69: 
   70: %% Test that the various options to connect work as expected.
   71: connect(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
   72: connect(Config) ->
   73:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
   74:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(wx:null(), 1, "Event Testing")),
   75:     Panel = ?mt(wxPanel, wxPanel:new(Frame)),
   76:     Window = wxWindow:new(Panel, -1),
   77: 
   78:     Tester = self(),
   79:     CB = fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{},userData=UserD}, SizeEvent) ->
   80: 		 ?mt(wxSizeEvent, SizeEvent),
   81: 		 Tester ! {got_size, UserD}
   82: 	 end,
   83:     
   84:     ?m(ok, wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, size,[{skip, true},{userData, panel}])),
   85:     ?m(ok, wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, size,[{callback,CB},{userData, panel}])),
   86: 
   87:     ?m({'EXIT', {{badarg,_},_}}, 
   88:        wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, there_is_no_such_event)),
   89: 
   90:     ?m({'EXIT', {{badarg,_},_}}, 
   91:        wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, there_is_no_such_event, [{callback,CB}])),
   92: 
   93:     ?m(ok, wxWindow:connect(Window, size,[{callback,CB},{userData, window}])),
   94:     ?m(ok, wxWindow:connect(Window, size,[{skip,true},{userData, window}])),
   95: 
   96:     %% For trivial side effect free callbacks, can deadlock easily otherwise
   97:     CB1 = fun(_,_) -> Tester ! {got_size, nospawn_cb} end,
   98:     ?m(ok, wxWindow:connect(Frame,  size, [{callback,{nospawn, CB1}}])),
   99:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:connect(Frame,  size, [{skip, true}])),
  100:     ?m(true, wxFrame:show(Frame)),
  101: 
  102:     wxWindow:setSize(Panel, {200,100}),
  103:     wxWindow:setSize(Window, {200,100}),
  104: 
  105:     get_size_messages(Frame, [frame, panel_cb, window_cb, window, nospawn_cb]),
  106:     
  107:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  108: 
  109: get_size_messages(_, []) -> ok;    
  110: get_size_messages(Frame, Msgs) ->
  111:     receive 
  112: 	#wx{obj=Frame,event=#wxSize{}} ->  %% ok
  113: 	    get_size_messages(Frame, lists:delete(frame, Msgs));
  114: 	#wx{userData=window, event=#wxSize{}} ->
  115: 	    ?m(true, lists:member(window_cb, Msgs)),	   
  116: 	    get_size_messages(Frame, lists:delete(window, Msgs));
  117: 	#wx{userData=panel, event=#wxSize{}} ->
  118: 	    ?m(true, lists:member(panel, Msgs)),	   
  119: 	    get_size_messages(Frame, lists:delete(panel, Msgs));
  120: 	{got_size,window} ->
  121: 	    ?m(false, lists:member(window, Msgs)),
  122: 	    get_size_messages(Frame, lists:delete(window_cb, Msgs));
  123: 	{got_size,panel} -> 
  124: 	    get_size_messages(Frame, lists:delete(panel_cb, Msgs));
  125: 	{got_size,nospawn_cb} ->
  126: 	    get_size_messages(Frame, lists:delete(nospawn_cb, Msgs));
  127: 	Other ->
  128: 	    ?error("Got unexpected msg ~p ~p~n", [Other,Msgs])
  129:     after 1000 ->
  130: 	    ?error("Timeout ~p~n", [Msgs])
  131:     end.
  132: 
  133: disconnect(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  134: disconnect(Config) ->
  135:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  136:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(wx:null(), 1, "Event Testing")),
  137:     Panel = ?mt(wxPanel, wxPanel:new(Frame)),
  138: 
  139:     Tester = self(),
  140:     CB = fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{},userData=UserD}, SizeEvent) ->
  141: 		 ?mt(wxSizeEvent, SizeEvent),
  142: 		 Tester ! {got_size, UserD}
  143: 	 end,
  144:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:connect(Frame,  close_window)),
  145:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:connect(Frame,  size)),
  146:     ?m(ok, wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, size,[{skip, true},{userData, panel}])),
  147:     ?m(ok, wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, size,[{callback,CB},{userData, panel}])),
  148: 
  149:     ?m(true, wxFrame:show(Frame)),
  150: 
  151:     wxWindow:setSize(Panel, {200,100}),    
  152:     get_size_messages(Frame, [frame, panel_cb]),
  153:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  154: 
  155:     ?m(true, wxEvtHandler:disconnect(Panel, size, [{callback,CB}])),
  156:     ?m(ok, wxWindow:setSize(Panel, {200,101})),
  157:     get_size_messages(Frame, [panel]),
  158:     timer:sleep(1000),
  159:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  160: 
  161:     ?m(false, wxEvtHandler:disconnect(Panel, non_existing_event_type)),
  162:     ?m(true, wxEvtHandler:disconnect(Panel, size)),
  163:     ?m(ok, wxWindow:setSize(Panel, {200,102})),
  164:     timer:sleep(1000),
  165:     ?m([], wx_test_lib:flush()),
  166: 
  167:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  168: 
  169: 
  170: 
  171: disconnect_cb(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  172: disconnect_cb(Config) ->
  173:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  174:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(wx:null(), 1, "Event Testing")),
  175:     Panel = ?mt(wxPanel, wxPanel:new(Frame)),
  176: 
  177:     Tester = self(),
  178:     CB = fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{},userData=UserD}, SizeEvent) ->
  179: 		 ?mt(wxSizeEvent, SizeEvent),
  180: 		 wxEvtHandler:disconnect(Frame, close_window),
  181: 		 Tester ! {got_size, UserD}
  182: 	 end,
  183:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:connect(Frame,  close_window)),
  184:     ?m(ok, wxFrame:connect(Frame,  size)),
  185:     ?m(ok, wxEvtHandler:connect(Panel, size, [{callback,CB},{userData, panel}])),
  186: 
  187:     ?m(true, wxFrame:show(Frame)),
  188: 
  189:     wxWindow:setSize(Panel, {200,100}),
  190:     get_size_messages(Frame, [frame, panel_cb]),
  191:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  192: 
  193:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  194: 
  195: %% Test that the msg events are forwarded as supposed to 
  196: connect_msg_20(TestInfo) 
  197:   when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  198: connect_msg_20(Config) ->
  199:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  200:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(wx:null(), 1, "Event 20 Testing")),
  201:     Tester = self(),
  202:     Env = wx:get_env(),
  203:     
  204:     EvtHandler = fun() ->
  205: 			 wx:set_env(Env),
  206: 			 wxFrame:connect(Frame,size,[{skip,true}]),
  207: 			 Tester ! initiated,
  208: 			 receive #wx{obj=Frame,event=#wxSize{}} ->
  209: 				 Tester ! got_it
  210: 			 end
  211: 		 end,
  212:     Msgs = [begin spawn_link(EvtHandler), got_it end|| _ <- lists:seq(1,20)],
  213: 
  214:     ?m_multi_receive(lists:duplicate(20, initiated)),    
  215:     ?m(true, wxFrame:show(Frame)),
  216: 
  217:     ?m_multi_receive(Msgs),
  218:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  219: 
  220: %% Test that the callbacks works as msgs
  221: connect_cb_20(TestInfo) 
  222:   when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  223: connect_cb_20(Config) ->
  224:     ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  225:     Frame = ?mt(wxFrame, wxFrame:new(wx:null(), 1, "Event 20 Testing")),
  226:     Tester = self(),
  227:     Env = wx:get_env(),
  228:     
  229:     wxFrame:connect(Frame,size,[{callback, 
  230: 				 fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{}},_SizeEv) -> 
  231: 					 Tester ! main_got_it
  232: 				 end}]),
  233: 
  234:     EvtHandler = fun() ->
  235: 			 wx:set_env(Env),
  236: 			 Self = self(),
  237: 			 CB = fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{}}, 
  238: 				  WxSizeEventObj) ->
  239: 				      wxEvent:skip(WxSizeEventObj),
  240: 				      Tester ! got_it,
  241: 				      Self ! quit
  242: 			      end,
  243: 			 wxFrame:connect(Frame,size,[{callback, CB}]),
  244: 			 Tester ! initiated,
  245: 			 receive quit -> ok
  246: 			 end
  247: 		 end,
  248:     Msgs = [begin spawn_link(EvtHandler), got_it end|| _ <- lists:seq(1,20)],
  249:     
  250:     ?m_multi_receive(lists:duplicate(20, initiated)),
  251:     ?m(true, wxFrame:show(Frame)),
  252:     
  253:     ?m_multi_receive(Msgs),
  254:     ?m_receive(main_got_it),
  255: 
  256:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  257:    
  258: 
  259: mouse_on_grid(TestInfo) 
  260:   when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  261: mouse_on_grid(Config) ->
  262:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  263:     
  264:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Frame"),
  265:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame, []),
  266:     Sizer = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  267:     
  268:     Grid = wxGrid:new(Panel, ?wxID_ANY),
  269:     wxGrid:createGrid(Grid, 10, 10, []),
  270:     wxSizer:add(Sizer, Grid, [{proportion, 1}]),
  271:         
  272:     wxWindow:connect(Panel, motion),
  273:     wxWindow:connect(Panel, middle_down), 
  274: 
  275:     %% Undocumented function
  276:     GridWindow = ?mt(wxWindow, wxGrid:getGridWindow(Grid)),
  277:     wxWindow:connect(GridWindow, motion),
  278:     wxWindow:connect(GridWindow, middle_down),
  279: 
  280:     wxWindow:setSizerAndFit(Panel, Sizer),
  281:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  282:     
  283:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  284: 
  285: 
  286: spin_event(TestInfo) 
  287:   when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  288: spin_event(Config) ->
  289:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  290: 
  291:     %% Spin events and scrollEvent share some events id's
  292:     %% test that they work
  293: 
  294:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Spin Events"),
  295:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame, []),
  296:     Sizer = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  297:     HSz = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxHORIZONTAL),
  298: 
  299:     SB = wxSpinButton:new(Panel, [{id, 100}]),
  300:     wxSizer:add(HSz, SB, []),
  301:     wxSpinButton:connect(SB, spin),
  302:     wxSpinButton:connect(SB, spin_up),
  303:     wxSpinButton:connect(SB, spin_down),
  304: 
  305:     SC = wxSpinCtrl:new(Panel, [{id, 101}, {min, -12}, {max, 12}, 
  306: 				{value, "-3"}, {initial, 3}, 
  307: 				{style, ?wxSP_ARROW_KEYS bor ?wxSP_WRAP}]),
  308:     wxSpinCtrl:connect(SC, command_spinctrl_updated),
  309:     wxSizer:add(HSz, SC, [{proportion, 1}, {flag, ?wxEXPAND}]),
  310:     wxSizer:add(Sizer, HSz, [{proportion, 0},{flag, ?wxEXPAND}]),
  311:     
  312:     SL = wxSlider:new(Panel, 102, 57, 22, 99),
  313:     wxSlider:connect(SL, scroll_thumbtrack),
  314:     wxSlider:connect(SL, scroll_lineup),
  315:     wxSlider:connect(SL, scroll_linedown),
  316:     wxSizer:add(Sizer, SL, [{proportion, 0},{flag, ?wxEXPAND}]),
  317:        
  318:     wxWindow:setSizerAndFit(Panel, Sizer),
  319:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  320:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  321: 
  322: %% Set value does not generate a spin event...
  323: %%     wxSpinButton:setValue(SB, 7),
  324: %%     ?m_receive(#wx{id=100, event=#wxSpin{type=spin}}),
  325: %%     wxSpinCtrl:setValue(SC, 8),
  326: %%     ?m_receive(#wx{id=101, event=#wxSpin{type=command_spinctrl_updated}}),
  327: %%     wxSlider:setValue(SL, 29),
  328: %%     ?m_receive(#wx{id=102, event=#wxScroll{}}),
  329: 
  330:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  331: 
  332: 
  333: %% Test that we can connect to events from inside a callback fun
  334: %% This is needed for example inside a callback that does a wxWindow:popupMenu/2
  335: connect_in_callback(TestInfo) 
  336:   when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  337: connect_in_callback(Config) ->
  338:     Wx = ?mr(wx_ref, wx:new()),
  339:     %% wx:debug([driver,trace]),
  340:     %% io:format("gdb -p ~s~n",[os:getpid()]),
  341:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Connect in callback"),
  342:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame, []),
  343: 
  344:     Tester = self(),
  345: 
  346:     %% Connect in callbacks works different in 2.9
  347:     %% such that new events are not fired until the previous
  348:     %% callback have returned.
  349: 
  350:     %% That means that a callback cannot wait for other events
  351:     %% in receive since they will not come.
  352:     %% It also means that you cannot attach a new callback directly from
  353:     %% the callback since that callback will be removed when the temporary
  354:     %% process that executes the outer callback (may) die(s) before the callback
  355:     %% is invoked
  356: 
  357:     %% Thus connect in callbacks needs to done in a another process, and
  358:     %% not in the fun directly
  359:     Env = wx:get_env(),
  360:     TestWindow =
  361: 	fun() ->
  362: 		wx:set_env(Env),
  363: 		Me = self(),
  364: 		F1 = wxFrame:new(Frame, ?wxID_ANY, "Frame size event"),
  365: 		wxFrame:connect(F1,size,[{callback,
  366: 					  fun(_,_) ->
  367: 						  io:format("CB2 got size~n",[]),
  368: 						  Me ! {continue, F1}
  369: 					  end}]),
  370: 		wxWindow:show(F1),
  371: 		receive
  372: 		    {continue, F1} ->
  373: 			true = wxFrame:disconnect(F1, size),
  374: 			Tester ! {continue, F1}
  375: 		end
  376: 	end,
  377:     wxFrame:connect(Frame,show,
  378: 		    [{callback,
  379: 		      fun(#wx{event=#wxShow{}},_SizeEv) ->
  380: 			      io:format("Frame got size~n",[]),
  381: 			      spawn(TestWindow)
  382: 		      end}]),
  383:     wxPanel:connect(Panel,size,
  384: 		    [{callback,
  385: 		      fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{}},_SizeEv) ->
  386: 			      io:format("Panel got size~n",[]),
  387: 			      spawn(fun() ->
  388: 					    wx:set_env(Env),
  389: 					    F1 = wxFrame:new(Frame, ?wxID_ANY,
  390: 							     "Panel size event"),
  391: 					    wxFrame:connect(F1,size),
  392: 					    wxWindow:show(F1),
  393: 					    receive
  394: 						#wx{event=#wxSize{}} ->
  395: 						    io:format("All Fine ~n",[]),
  396: 						    wxFrame:destroy(F1)
  397: 					    end
  398: 				    end)
  399: 		      end}]),
  400:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  401: 
  402:     ok = receive {continue, F1} -> wxFrame:destroy(F1)
  403: 	 after 5000 -> timeout end,
  404:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  405:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  406: 
  407: %% Test that event callback which triggers another callback works
  408: %% i.e. the callback invoker in driver will recurse
  409: recursive(TestInfo)   when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  410: recursive(Config) ->
  411:     Wx = wx:new(),
  412:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Connect in callback"),
  413:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame, []),
  414:     Sz = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  415:     Ctrl1 = wxTextCtrl:new(Panel, ?wxID_ANY, [{size, {300, -1}}]),
  416:     Ctrl2 = wxTextCtrl:new(Panel, ?wxID_ANY, [{size, {300, -1}}]),
  417:     wxSizer:add(Sz, Ctrl1, [{proportion, 1},{flag, ?wxEXPAND}]),
  418:     wxSizer:add(Sz, Ctrl2, [{proportion, 1},{flag, ?wxEXPAND}]),
  419:     wxWindow:setSizerAndFit(Panel, Sz),
  420: 
  421:     CB1 =  fun(#wx{event=#wxCommand{cmdString=String}}, _) ->
  422: 		   io:format(" CB1: ~s~n",[String]),
  423: 		   wxTextCtrl:setValue(Ctrl2, io_lib:format("from CB1 ~s", [String]))
  424: 	   end,
  425:     CB2 =  fun(#wx{event=#wxCommand{cmdString=String}}, _) ->
  426: 		   io:format("    CB2: ~s~n",[String]),
  427: 		   ok
  428: 	   end,
  429:     wxTextCtrl:connect(Ctrl1, command_text_updated, [{callback,CB1}]),
  430:     wxTextCtrl:connect(Ctrl2, command_text_updated, [{callback,CB2}]),
  431:     wxFrame:connect(Frame, size,
  432: 		    [{callback,
  433: 		      fun(#wx{event=#wxSize{size=Size}}, _) ->
  434: 			      io:format("Size init: ~s ~n",[wxTextCtrl:getValue(Ctrl2)]),
  435: 			      wxTextCtrl:setValue(Ctrl1, io_lib:format("Size ~p", [Size])),
  436: 			      io:format("Size done: ~s ~n",[wxTextCtrl:getValue(Ctrl2)])
  437: 		      end}]),
  438:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  439:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  440: 
  441:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  442: 
  443: 
  444: dialog(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  445: dialog(Config) ->
  446:     Wx = wx:new(),
  447:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Testing"),
  448:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  449:     Env = wx:get_env(),
  450:     Tester = self(),
  451:     PD = wxProgressDialog:new("Dialog","Testing",
  452: 			      [%%{parent, Frame},
  453: 			       {maximum,101},
  454: 			       {style, ?wxPD_SMOOTH bor ?wxPD_AUTO_HIDE}]),
  455:     Forward = fun(#wx{event=#wxInitDialog{}}, Ev) ->
  456: 		      ?mt(wxInitDialogEvent, Ev),
  457: 		      io:format("Heyhoo~n", []),
  458: 		      wxEvent:skip(Ev),
  459: 		      Tester ! {progress_dialog,PD}
  460: 	      end,
  461:     wxDialog:connect(PD, init_dialog, [{callback, Forward}]),
  462:     Recurse = fun(Recurse, N) ->
  463: 		      true = wxProgressDialog:update(PD, min(N,100)),
  464: 		      timer:sleep(5),
  465: 		      Recurse(Recurse,N+1)
  466: 	      end,
  467:     Run = fun() ->
  468: 		  wx:set_env(Env),
  469: 		  Recurse(Recurse, 0)
  470: 	  end,
  471:     Worker = spawn_link(Run),
  472:     timer:sleep(500),
  473:     io:format("Got ~p~n", [wx_test_lib:flush()]),
  474:     unlink(Worker),
  475:     wxProgressDialog:destroy(PD),
  476:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  477: 
  478: 
  479: 
  480: char_events(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  481: char_events(Config) ->
  482:     Wx = wx:new(),
  483:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Press any key"),
  484:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame, []),
  485:     wxFrame:connect(Frame, enter_window, [{callback, fun(_,_) ->
  486: 							     io:format("Set focus~n"),
  487: 							     wxWindow:setFocus(Panel)
  488: 						     end}]),
  489:     KeyEvent = fun(Ev,Obj) -> io:format("Got ~p~n",[Ev]), wxEvent:skip(Obj) end,
  490:     [wxWindow:connect(Panel, Types, [{callback,KeyEvent}])
  491:      || Types <- [key_down, key_up, char]],
  492:     wxWindow:connect(Frame, char_hook, [{callback,KeyEvent}]),
  493: 
  494:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  495:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  496: 
  497:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  498: 
  499: mouse_events(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  500: mouse_events(Config) ->
  501:     Wx = wx:new(),
  502:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Press mouse keys"),
  503:     SB = wxFrame:createStatusBar(Frame),
  504:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame, []),
  505:     Status = fun(#wxMouse{x=X,y=Y}) ->
  506:                      HasC = wxPanel:hasCapture(Panel),
  507:                      Str = io_lib:format("Pos: X=~w Y=~w Captured: ~w~n",[X,Y, HasC]),
  508:                      wxStatusBar:setStatusText(SB, Str),
  509:                      ok
  510:              end,
  511:     MouseEvent = fun(#wx{event=#wxMouse{type=mousewheel, wheelRotation=Rot}=Ev}, Obj) ->
  512:                          Status(Ev),
  513:                          Axis = wxMouseEvent:getWheelAxis(Obj),
  514:                          io:format("Got wheel ~w ~w~n",[Rot,Axis]),
  515:                          wxEvent:skip(Obj);
  516:                     (#wx{event=#wxMouse{type=right_up}=Ev}, _Obj) ->
  517:                          case wxPanel:hasCapture(Panel) of
  518:                              true  ->
  519:                                  io:format("right_up: release mouse~n"),
  520:                                  wxPanel:releaseMouse(Panel);
  521:                              false ->
  522:                                  io:format("right_up: capture mouse (release with right_up again)~n"),
  523:                                  wxPanel:captureMouse(Panel)
  524:                          end,
  525:                          Status(Ev);
  526:                     (#wx{event=#wxMouse{type=What}=Ev},Obj) ->
  527:                          io:format("Got ~p~n",[What]),
  528:                          Status(Ev),
  529:                          wxEvent:skip(Obj)
  530:                  end,
  531:     [wxWindow:connect(Panel, Types, [{callback,MouseEvent}])
  532:      || Types <- [left_down, left_up, right_up, right_down,
  533:                   middle_up, middle_down, mousewheel]],
  534:     Motion = fun(#wx{event=Ev}, Obj) ->
  535:                      Status(Ev),
  536:                      wxEvent:skip(Obj)
  537:              end,
  538:     wxWindow:connect(Panel, motion, [{callback,Motion}]),
  539: 
  540:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  541:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  542: 
  543:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  544: 
  545: callback_clean(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) -> wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  546: callback_clean(Config) ->
  547:     %% Be sure that event handling are cleanup up correctly and don't keep references to old
  548:     %% fun's and event listeners
  549:     Wx = wx:new(),
  550:     Frame = wxFrame:new(Wx, ?wxID_ANY, "Frame Window"),
  551:     wxFrame:show(Frame),
  552: 
  553:     %% wx:debug([verbose,driver]),
  554:     Dlg = wxDialog:new(Frame, ?wxID_ANY, "Testing"),
  555:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Dlg, []),
  556:     Sizer = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxVERTICAL),
  557:     Button = wxButton:new(Panel, 600, [{label, "Foobar"}]),
  558:     wxSizer:add(Sizer, Button, [{proportion,1}, {flag, ?wxEXPAND}]),
  559:     wxSizer:add(Sizer, wxDialog:createStdDialogButtonSizer(Dlg,?wxOK bor ?wxCANCEL)),
  560:     wxDialog:setSizerAndFit(Dlg, Sizer),
  561: 
  562:     Env = wx:get_env(),
  563:     SetupEventHandlers =
  564: 	fun() ->
  565: 		wx:set_env(Env),
  566: 		Me = self(),
  567: 		Print = fun(#wx{id=ID, event=#wxCommand{}},Ev) ->
  568: 				io:format("~p Clicked ~p~n", [self(), ID]),
  569: 				Me ! #wx{event=#wxClose{}},
  570: 				wxEvent:skip(Ev, [{skip, true}]);
  571: 			   (#wx{id=ID, event=#wxClose{}},Ev) ->
  572: 				io:format("~p Closed ~p~n", [self(), ID]),
  573: 				wxEvent:skip(Ev, [{skip, true}])
  574: 			end,
  575: 
  576: 		wxDialog:connect(Dlg, command_button_clicked,[{callback,Print}]),
  577: 		wxDialog:connect(Dlg, close_window, [{skip, true}])
  578: 	end,
  579:     ?m({[],[],[]}, white_box_check_event_handlers()),
  580:     Pid = spawn_link(fun() ->
  581:     			     SetupEventHandlers(),
  582:     			     receive #wx{event=#wxClose{}} -> ok;
  583:     				     remove -> ok
  584:     			     end
  585:     		     end),
  586:     timer:sleep(500), %% Give it time to remove it
  587:     ?m({[{Pid,_}],[_],[_]}, white_box_check_event_handlers()),
  588: 
  589:     Pid ! remove,
  590:     timer:sleep(500), %% Give it time to remove it
  591:     ?m({[],[],[]}, white_box_check_event_handlers()),
  592: 
  593:     SetupEventHandlers(),
  594:     ?m({[{_,_}],[_],[_]}, white_box_check_event_handlers()),
  595: 
  596:     wxDialog:show(Dlg),
  597:     wx_test_lib:wx_close(Dlg, Config),
  598:     wxDialog:destroy(Dlg),
  599:     timer:sleep(500), %% Give it time to remove it
  600:     ?m({[],[],[]}, white_box_check_event_handlers()),
  601: 
  602:     wx_test_lib:flush(),
  603:     io:format("**Deleting Frame**~n",[]),
  604:     wx_test_lib:wx_destroy(Frame, Config).
  605:     %% timer:sleep(infinity),
  606:     %% ok.
  607: 
  608: 
  609: white_box_check_event_handlers() ->
  610:     {_,_,Server,_} = wx:get_env(),
  611:     {status, _, _, [Env, _, _, _, Data]} = sys:get_status(Server),
  612:     [_H, _data, {data, [{_, Record}]}] = Data,
  613:     {state, _Port1, Users, [], CBs, _Next} = Record,
  614:     {[{Pid, Evs} ||
  615: 	 {Pid, {user, Evs}} <- gb_trees:to_list(Users),
  616: 	 Evs =/= []], %% Ignore empty
  617:      gb_trees:to_list(CBs),
  618:      [Funs || Funs = {Id, {Fun,_}} <- Env, is_integer(Id), is_function(Fun)]
  619:     }.
  620: 
  621: handler_clean(TestInfo) when is_atom(TestInfo) ->
  622:     wx_test_lib:tc_info(TestInfo);
  623: handler_clean(_Config) ->
  624:     wx:new(),
  625:     Init = fun() -> create_window() end,
  626:     Frame1 = wx_obj_test:start([{init, Init}]),
  627:     ?mt(wxFrame, Frame1),
  628:     wxWindow:show(Frame1),
  629:     timer:sleep(500),
  630:     ?m([_|_], lists:sort(wx_test_lib:flush())),
  631:     ?m(ok, wx_obj_test:stop(Frame1)),
  632:     ?m([{terminate,normal}], lists:sort(wx_test_lib:flush())),
  633: 
  634:     Terminate = fun({Frame,_}) -> wxWindow:destroy(Frame) end,
  635:     Frame2 = wx_obj_test:start([{init, Init}, {terminate, Terminate}]),
  636:     wxWindow:show(Frame2),
  637:     timer:sleep(500),
  638:     ?m([_|_], lists:sort(wx_test_lib:flush())),
  639:     ?m(ok, wx_obj_test:stop(Frame2)),
  640:     ?m([{terminate,normal}], lists:sort(wx_test_lib:flush())),
  641:     timer:sleep(104),
  642:     ?m({[],[],[]}, white_box_check_event_handlers()),
  643:     ?m(ok, wx:destroy()),
  644:     ok.
  645: 
  646: create_window() ->
  647:     Frame = wxFrame:new(wx:null(), ?wxID_ANY, "Test wx_object", [{size, {500, 400}}]),
  648:     Sz = wxBoxSizer:new(?wxHORIZONTAL),
  649:     Panel = wxPanel:new(Frame),
  650:     wxSizer:add(Sz, Panel, [{flag, ?wxEXPAND}, {proportion, 1}]),
  651:     wxWindow:connect(Frame, show),
  652:     %% wxPanel:connect(Panel, paint, [callback, {userData, foobar}]),
  653:     wxWindow:connect(Panel, size, [callback]),
  654:     {Frame, {Frame, Panel}}.
